revised_title: Effects of Two-Dimensional Reynolds Roughness in Hydrodynamic Lubrication
tldr: This article analyzes the hydrodynamic lubrication of rough surfaces using the Reynolds equation, focusing on the general two-dimensional surface roughness. The study reveals that roughness effects consist of two parts: one depends on the shape of the autocorrelation function, and the other does not. The results apply to any type of two-dimensional roughness and provide insights into the behavior of lubrication performance parameters.
